meanings.definition: A type of Eastern European dumpling filled with potato, cheese, or meat.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious perogy for dinner last night.
meanings.sent2: My grandma makes the best perogies in town.
meanings.sent3: The perogy jumped out of the pot and started dancing on the table!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as comforting as a warm perogy on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly cooked perogy filled the room with warmth and happiness.

meanings.sent1: I love to perogy with my family on weekends.
meanings.sent2: Let's perogy together at the new restaurant in town.
meanings.sent3: He decided to perogy all day long, much to the surprise of his friends.
meanings.sent4: She perogied her way through the buffet, trying every dish available.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled as they perogied their way through the picnic, enjoying every bite.
